intro: Diplycosia bartlettii, commonly known as the Bartlett's diplycosia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in dry, sunny environments. Its small, white or pale pink flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, woody fruits that contain the seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Diplycosia bartlettii is considered a conservation concern.
